sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Iceland, stricter COVID-19 restrictions started this week and are expected to run until at least the 2nd of February. And premises that do not serve food will have to close completely again. Iceland is struggling with a record number of patients putting pressure on the health system. Over in Portugal, people who have been assigned to work at polling stations in the upcoming general election began receiving their coronavirus booster shots. It will take many hours and there'll be hundreds of people. We touch cards and all that so this is really important. The government is still waiting on a decision from the Portuguese Attorney General on whether those voters in isolation or infected with the virus would be allowed to vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A large demo took place in Paris as the French Parliament debates a bill that would force most people to be vaccinated in order to enter public spaces such as bars, restaurants and long-distance public transport. And thousands of activists also took part in a rally in the Austrian capital Vienna to protest against the planned compulsory vaccination starting in February.

sentences.sentence: In the Italian capital Rome, hundreds of anti-vax activists, most of them without masks, gathered on Saturday in the Piazza San Giovanni. They are angry over Prime Minister Mario Draghi's government's tightening of measures, including compulsory vaccination for the over-50s, due to come into force from February 15th.
